main event: Observers sighted a blue-white light near Johnsonburg, Pennsylvania, that traveled in a generally direction for approximately 60 seconds, making several slight changes in direction without changing its speed.
interesting points: The observers were checking stars and instruments when they noticed the light., The object was observed hovering and changing color from bright white to reddish orange., It suddenly shot straight up into the sky at a high rate of speed and disappeared., The object was larger than satellites and moved silently in the sky., The sighting occurred on a clear night, allowing easy visibility against the dark sky.
sighted object: a blue-white light in the sky
witness description: Mr. and Mrs. [Redacted], who had an interest in the subject for over 25 years.
